title: Where did the bitten slice of Apple logo go? - Quora

response.answer_text: The story I heard is that this. The original logo was a big complicated image with Isaac Newton. Then for a very short time they actually used a full red apple. But it did not work in black and white or green and black. And you could not distinguish an apple from a cherry. So they added the byte (kilobyte). It was also a conspiracy theory that the bite was a hat off to Alan Turing, who bit into a poisonous apple, laced with cyanide, would be cool if true but I doubt it as any hat off that Apple would do in my opinion would be to HP.

Thanks for the A2A. Nowhere. There is no “bitten slice of Apple Logo.” The logo is shown with a bite out of it as part of the logo. It was designed that way initially, the “missing” bite never existed in the first place.
